availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
County of Jefferson Sct.

The affiant Henry Russell, Says that he is deputy Marshal for the city court of Louisville; and that on the 4th day of August 1864, he arrested on a Felony Warrant one Jenni Emma Morris; and on the next day She was presented in the city court charged with a felony Stealing Some $42 from one Jennie Summers; On this charge She was held to bail in to answer in the Jefferson Circuit Court; She gave bail to answer on the third Monday in this month; but She failed to answer and made default She has absconded from the State of Kentucky and as affiant is in formed She is now in the State of Tennessee a fugitive from Justice
Subscribed & Sworn to before me by Henry Russell this 24th Octo 1864
Geo W. Johnston Judge city court Louisville Kenty
